perturbation.original_text: e. "Net Revenue" shall mean gross receipts collected by Company or Reseller from the distribution of Company Products, [less third party commissions, equipment sales, delivery costs, taxes, refunds, and credits.
perturbation.changed_text: e. "Net Revenue" shall mean gross receipts collected by Company or Distributor from the distribution of Company Products, less third party commissions. equipment sales, delivery costs, taxes, refunds, and credits.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'Reseller' to 'Distributor' in the definition of 'Net Revenue', the contract introduces ambiguity about whether 'Reseller' and 'Distributor' are the same entity, especially since other sections consistently use 'Reseller'. This creates uncertainty about who is responsible for generating net revenue.

perturbation.original_text: Company develops or provides Company Products and desires that Reseller promote and solicit commitments to buy Company Products in the Territory.
perturbation.changed_text: Company develops or provides Company Products and desires that Vendor promote and solicit commitments to buy Company Products in the Territory.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'Reseller' to 'Vendor,' the contract creates confusion over who is responsible for promoting and soliciting sales within the defined 'Territory.' The contract never defines what vendor means, which leaves the enforcement ambiguous.

perturbation.original_text: Company shall indemnify, defend and hold Reseller and its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, agents, successors and assigns, harmless from and against any claim, demand lawsuit, cause of action or losses of any nature whatsoever, including reasonable attorneys' fees, suffered or incurred by Reseller or any of them, arising out of, (i) any claim that the Company Products infringe any U.S. patent or copyright or that the Company Products incorporate any misappropriated trade secrets or (ii) any claim for injury or other loss to any person arising from the use of Company Products. Additionally, Reseller shall indemnify, defend and hold Company and its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, agents, successors and assigns, harmless from and against any claim, demand lawsuit, cause of action or losses of any nature whatsoever, including reasonable attorneys' fees, suffered or incurred by Company or any of them, arising out of, (i) any claim that the Reseller's Activities infringe any U.S. Business law or that the Reseller's Activities violate any U.S. government process, procedure or requirement or (ii) any claim for injury or other loss to any person arising from the use of Reseller's Activities.
perturbation.changed_text: Company shall indemnify, defend and hold Partner and its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, agents, successors and assigns, harmless from and against any claim, demand lawsuit, cause of action or losses of any nature whatsoever, including reasonable attorneys' fees, suffered or incurred by Reseller or any of them, arising out of, (i) any claim that the Company Products infringe any U.S. patent or copyright or that the Company Products incorporate any misappropriated trade secrets or (ii) any claim for injury or other loss to any person arising from the use of Company Products. Additionally, Reseller shall indemnify, defend and hold Company and its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, agents, successors and assigns, harmless from and against any claim, demand lawsuit, cause of action or losses of any nature whatsoever, including reasonable attorneys' fees, suffered or incurred by Company or any of them, arising out of, (i) any claim that the Reseller's Activities infringe any U.S. Business law or that the Reseller's Activities violate any U.S. government process, procedure or requirement or (ii) any claim for injury or other loss to any person arising from the use of Reseller's Activities.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'Reseller' to 'Partner' in the first line of the indemnification clause, the contract creates uncertainty about who the Company is obligated to indemnify. This weakens the indemnification provision and could lead to disputes over liability.
